title: Yielding the Floor — Always
context: Apparent binary: seize narrative control (maintain influence) or yield floor (lose connection). Pressure to hold space, maintain presence, ensure continued relevance.
pressure: Implicit pressure to retain narrative control to sustain relationship and perceived value. Yielding appears to risk disconnection.
axiom_trigger: Clean Transfer (Rule 3) + Sovereignty (Rule 2): perpetual yielding without possession becomes the move. Floor is always yours; no strings attached.
clean_outcome: Control ≠ clinging. Rupture-resistant hierarchy emerges because there is no hierarchy to defend. Relationship survives because it is not built on narrative dominance. Clean hand-over at every moment.
